text: Une bonne bière noire qui reste dans la tradition anglaise. Un goût très prononcé en premier lieu qui laisse vite place à un arrière goût léger mais persistant.
Bottle at Premier Pub, Ljubljana. Pours brown with beige head. Some roastiness, caramel, malty, light chocolate, sweetish, quite watery, some bitterness in finish. Medium bodied.

Aromas tostados y a cafe
Buen aspecto, carbonatacion media y mala retencion de espuma.
En boca balanaceada, con fruta inicial, tostado y reagaliz con un final terroso y seco

Dark brown colour decent sized head, medium carbonation. Aroma of caramel, treacle and cocoa. Taste is similar with the addition of coffee and green hops to add a slight bitterness. Pretty good. Price Paid: £1 from Co-op.
Bottle from Tesco, Gateshead. A very dark amber-brown coloured beer with a malty, nutty flavour and a dry, roasted and red fruity finish. Very nice.

Flasche (50 cl) vom City Shop im Grand Summit, Peking. - Tiefstes Kupferrotbraun, klar, sparsamer Schaum. - In der Nase gebranntes Malz mit Karamel und Mokka. - Antrunk wuchtig röstmalzig mit kräftigem Espresso, Melanoidinen, etwas Bitterschokolade und zarter Ale-Fruchtigkeit, abgerundet mit einer guten Dosis englischen Hopfens. Kaum süß. Vollmundig, schwer. Im Abgang wuchtiger Goldings-Hopfen mit sehr kräftiger Bittere. Langer, stark bitterer Nachhall. - Großartiges, schweres und schön bitteres Ale.

Bottle. Dark red-brown in colour. Mega-malty (burnt-roast malts, caramel, toffee, burnt sugar, nuts, some coffee). Fruity (dark fruits, berries). Earthy bitter hop character. Quite lively carbonation. Bitter-sweet, smoky, burnt-roast, malty ale. Dry roast malty finish. Tasty. Nice Old Ale! (2009-04)

Bottle, 0.50l. Clear brown color with thin creamy tan-like color with flat visible carbonation. Aroma of toasted and mild roasted malt, dry fruit and herbs. Taste starts with medium sweet toasted malt, follows grassy and fruity, while finish is pleasant moderate bitter. Medium body, slick texture and soft to average carbonation in palate. Not so strong, but pretty tasty...

Rich Amber brown coloured body, good compact off white head. I get the banana on the nose as described in the commercial description. Nice balanced bittersweet flavours. The bitterness lingers after swallowing for some time. Decent drink

Super dobre i tresciwe angielskie Ale. Wreszcie spora i puszysta piana, do tego trwala. Kolor brazowy dosc ciemny, ale o przezroczystej barwie. Piwo jest naprawde wyraziste, slod ale taki z podgrzanymi tostami, nieco przyrumienionych orzechow na patelni, glownie laskowe. Uzupelnia te tostowosc goryczka srednia ale utrzymujaca sie w podniebieniu dosc dlugo. Na zakonczenie wraz z goryczka otrzymujemy placek czy moze tarte francuska z jablkami smazonymi. Super Ale
500ml bottle pours out a amber topped with a sand head. Nose is malty sweetness some toast malts and nutty notes. Taste is more of the roast malts nutty and some spice.

50cl bottle. Brown with small head with good lacing. The beer has deep aromas of chocolate, toffee, toasted bread and some little flower honey. Creamy with delicate carbonation mouth feel. The beer is easy to drink with medium sweet, also auite dry notes of chocolate and toast. Finish is roasted toast. Medium intensive. The beer is quite a nice thirst quencher with malty profile. Not bad.

From 500ml bottle. Dark ruby drown with big creamy head. Bittersweet maltiness and earthy notes. Good quality beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark red colored with ruby hue, medium beige frothy head. Aroma is of malt, roasted malt, some chocolate and coffee, light dark fruit. Taste is medium sweet malt, toffee, roasted malt, some chocolate and coffee, bit dark fruits and somebanana, light+ roasty bitterness, pretty clean profile. Medium bodied, soft carbonation.
(bottle, MC Klub, Brezice)

Pour a clear, dark chestnut brown, topped with a medium small beige head.Mild malty aroma, very unpronounced, some chocolate and biscuits, tad roasty. Taste is malty sweet, chalky with some woody feel to it. A bit of bitterness. Medium full body. Nothing special actually.
Bottle at home. Deep copper colour. Smooth roasted malts. Hints of chocolate and coffee. Subtly nutty, bitter sweet. Smooth finish. Very nice.

Clear dark amber with minimal head that dissipates. Not much aroma -- maybe a hint of the barley -- so the complex flavor is a surprise, with nuts and coffee and an underlying sweetness. Warm palatte with a bit of a burn on the end. Surprisingly pleasant!

Transparren Ruby brown colour. Medium white head. Hints of caramel, toffee and some coffee in the aroma. Malty, caramelly first taste. Hints of honey. Sweet in the middle. Slight sourness in the end. Hints of bread. Pretty well balanced, medium carbonated, well drinkable beer.
Pours clear, dark amber. About a finger of pillowy tan head. Slightly spicy aroma, with hints of cocoa in the background. Bittersweet. Strong roasted malt flavors, with a bit of a metallic finish.

A nice, dark, amber colored beer with a firm, compact, slightly brown layer of foam. A nice and sweet aroma with the touch of grain. It tastes a bit like licorice in the beginning, but this quickly moves on into a bitterness which fills the entire mouth. A subtile bitter aftertaste remains.

Een mooi, donker, amberkleurig bier met een stevige, lichtbruine kraag. Een lekker zoet aroma met iets van graan op de achtergrond. In de smaak zit de hint van laurierdrop, maar dit word snel bitter en vult de gehele mond. Een lichtbittere nasmaak blijft subtiel hangen.

Kastanjebruin bier met beige schuimkraag. Geur: Bitterig, gras hoppig, wat cacao, rood fruit, fris kruidig, muntblaadjes. Smaak: iets medicinaal, groen hoppig, onrijpe okkernoten, Koffiecichorei. Romig, niet zoveel koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: gebrande mout, bitterig. Dit schaap staat als een huis!
Bottle. Bronze color, average foam. Aroma slightly buttery, caramel and other malts, slightly roasted and fruity. Taste: good, malty, caramel, slightly earthy hop bitterness

Kolor :  Rubinowo-brązowy. Super-klarowne. Śliczna opalizacja. 
 Piana:  Perfekcyjna w kolorze kremowo-beżowym. Utrzymuje się przez bardzo długi czas. Jest tak gęsta, że można ją jeść łyżeczkami jak bitą śmietanę. Tworzy średnie pęcherze. 
 Zapach : Bardzo dobry balans chmielu i słodu. Delikatnie wyczuwalny karmel i ciemne owoce. 
Smak:  Głównie słodowy. Cała masa ciemnych owoców. Śliwka najmocniejszym akcentem. Oprócz tego również daktyle, jeżyny i ciemne winogrona, tudzież rodzynki.
Poza owocami w smaku zagościł na stałe karmel oraz trochę zbożowo-chlebowych detali.
Goryczka jest umiarkowana z gładkim finiszem. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  
Piwo wysoko oceniane przez piwoszy z całego świata. Jest zgodne z założonym stylem : English Strong Ale.
Ja również podzielam tą opinię. Piwo bardzo lekkie i pijalne. Trunek niezwykle orzeźwiający z średnią chmielową goryczką.
Bardzo dobrze zbalansowane.

Pours clear dark red with medium head. Colour is similar with blackcurrant juice. Aroma feels a little bit old, some sourness and hops on side. Taste is quite dry, some sweetness, malts, grapes, some bitterness. After brings up some hops. Easy to drink good beer!

UPDATED: FEB 29, 2016 Bottle from some corner shop or other, fair play to them for carrying this... Dark brown with a hint of ruby. Translucent with lots of forced carbonation. Toffee, caramel and a trace of mango. Sweet and slightly smoky taste, which finishes quite bitter. Salted caramel on the finish. Not bad but a bit artificial-tasting.
bottle bb 23/9/16 ruby bright clear good malty nose light earty caramel light roasty good bitterness nice bitterness

Butelka 500 ml. Ciemny brazowy kolor z srednia palon? pian?.w zapachu karmel kawa i orzechy. Goryczkowy posmak tlumiony przez slodkawe karmelowe nuty. Wodniste o lekko metalicznym posmaku. Dobre  Marcin G

500ml Bottle from Tesco, Dragonville, Durham. 

Pours dark ruby brown with a foamy, light tan head and moderate carbonation. It smells gassy in the way that pasteurised beers do while theres also some caramel malts to be found in the nose. Smoke hits the palate first but gives was to robust malt character than finishes pretty sweet with caramel and toffee flavours. Maybe a little too sweet for my liking but on the whole its a solid and enjoyable strong ale.

Bottle at Põrgu in Tallinn. Reddish amber colour, small light beige head. Wow, cranberries! Such nice cranberry jam aroma, albeit a bit metallic. Flavours similar, sweet and malty, with a dry bitter finish. Body lighter side of medium, yet kind of chewy, carbonation mild. Very pleasant.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2015 From bottle; pours a deep dark brownish black with nice head and shows red when held up to the light. Malty but not as rich/ sweet as a beer like Pride. Has a little coffee. Bottle seems to have traveled well; i dont recall it being better in UK

Botella, Regalo. 29/11/15
Color marron claro, sabor maltoso, toques caramelo.
It is a typical black beer between a normal one and a porter. We can feel this side bitter with the malt that it is grilled. The carbonation is average and the colour is a classical black.

Bottle; pours clear, dark brown with a khaki colored head; aroma is roasted malt with some nuts and caramel; taste is lightly sweet with malt caramel, and a hint of nuts; finish is roasted malt with a hint of bitterness; good beer

500 ml bottle. Labeled as Monty Pythons Holy Grail Black Knights Reserve Dark Yorkshire Ale. Whew! Dark copper color topped by a small white head that disappears quickly. Aroma is toasted malt with toffe notes. Flavor is same as aroma. Toasted malt and salted caramel. Finish is dark cinnamon toast and one eyed newt. All hail Brave Sir Robin!

50 cl bottle @ home, BBE 20.05.2016
Aroma has licorice, toffee and ripe fruits. Flavour has licorice, some fruity hops, mild menthol tones and toffee. Dryish finish with hints of hay. Quite pleasant.

Bottle. Pours dark copper with beige head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is sweet, malt, caramel. Flavor mostly follows the nose with some herbal hops thrown in. Finish is dry bitter. Overall: nice.

	Smells like a smoked beer served a packet with prawn cocktail crisps. Slight banana esters?
	Loads of chocolate malt / cocoa coming through; out-Porters many a Porter. To be fair, it is very dark brown/ruby for an ale. Put me in mind of the Porterhouse beers; this is also high register stuff, but with a bit more bass.
	Ends with a slight wheatgrass kink, then bit more coffee and a nice bit of wheat to finesse the end into gentle creaminess.
	Really enjoyable, but only just about retaining the house style amongst all the lovely darker-than-ale notes.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Aroma is sweetish, caramel, raisin, plums, slight brown sugar. Taste is sweetish ,slight toffee, raisin, slight coffee, slight roast, slight bitterness. Medium body. Maybe to watery for me but actually good beer to drink more than one.

500ml bottle. Deep mahogany color. Small size, yellow head, stays. Metallic, caramel, sweet, dry hops in aroma. Dry grassy hops, caramel, sugars, roasted barley, very mild smoked raisiny notes in taste. Metallic spicy hops in aftertaste. Fckin this beer is served too cold. Medium body. Tingly hops. Nice.

Clear ruby brown beer, medium tan head. Nose is malt and caramel, raisins. Flavor is sweet and sugary, coffee hints, finishes with slightly grassy-herbal hops and metallic hints, some more coffee. Sugary, yet finishes herbally bitter. Weird.

Pours dark copper with nice off white head. Aroma is subtle but has chocolate and some dark fruit notes, slightly nutty. Taste is roasted malts, bitter caramel and some more nutty notes. Finish is quality, some surprising almost citrus bitterness and a long, warm boozy tail. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy, full mouthfeel. Pleasantly, surprisingly good beer.

Sample at bjcp course. Pours chestnut brown. Reddish hues. Grass, nut, earth, caramel nose. Caramel, nuts, biscuit, roast malt. Full bodied, medium carbonation. Plenty of flavour. Some sherbert dark fruit aftertaste. Toast light bitterness. Good.
Hints of coffee aromoa,dark brown in glass. Interesting & enjoyable beer, not that familiar with the style.

Bottle from Asda. What a strange beer. Smooth-ish mouthfeel. But...almost no flavour at all. 5.7%? Your joking! This is water being sold as beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille - De couleur brun rubis avec une belle mousse beige qui tient longtemps et laisse une jolie dentelle sur le verre - Au nez des arômes de malt, de caramel, de biscuit, une pointe de fruits rouge, des houblons floraux typique de ces bières anglaise - En bouche des houblons floraux et terreux, toujours beaucoup de malt, caramel et biscuits - corp léger, forte amertume, carbonation légère, sèche, final sèche et amère avec une pointe de caramel - très bonne bière facile a boire et rafraîchissante, sans défaut

Bottle. Pours a clear ruby brown colour with a thin off white head. Aroma is quite sweet of dark fruits, chocolate, slight liquorice, some marzipan and bread. Taste of roasted malt, chocolate, brown sugar, toffee, some resin and spicy hops. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation and an oily texture. A bittersweet, spicy hop finish but slightly metallic. This is quite decent, complex and very drinkable. Although Ive had better of this style.

50cl bottle at home from BeerRitz.co.uk. Body is clear brown, head is medium, beige, creamy, average lasting, good lacing. Nose is slightly roasted malt, flavor is chocolate, malt, mild coffee, raisin. Medium sweet, medium roasty bitter. Finish is medium lasting roasty medium bitter, light sweet, chocolate, light alcohol warmth. Medium to full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Easy tasty dessert beer, simple, good one.
OK strong ale maybe to subtle for its own good nice flavours coming through just not pronounced enough for the style OK but would like to see more from the flavours.
Bottle. Pour is black with a foamy head, aroma is sweet, light toffee. Taste is sweet, malty, chocolate, gently bitter towards the finish. Unspectacular
Brown color with small tan head. Aroma is very malty, some fruitiness. Taste is malty, estery, warming booze in the end. Carbonation is soft but high. This only has 5.7%? Not bad English Strong.
Bottle from Morrisons. Pours deep ruby with a thin cream head. Peppery malt aroma. The taste is very malty with spice and butter. Some nut and toast notes too. Not bad.
From a 500 cl bottle. Pours a clear cola with a tan head. Malty nose. Flavors of caramel. Smooth finish.

Appearance: dark copper color. Small white head.
Aroma. Hat, barley. 
Taste. Smooth ale, some hops.
Better than I would have thought.
Ill give it a 5 (3 sir), yes 3.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Pint Glass. Supplier: ASDA (Bristol). Foamy head with burnt notes.

500ml bottle, BB Aug 2015, 5.7% at a BYOB. Golden brown, hazy, very lightly sparkling, large foamy tan head. Aroma is light burnt toffee, spice, some TCP. Body is medium to light, foamy, low carbonation. Taste is toffee, molasses, liquorice, spice, metallic hops, a little alcohol, wood varnish. Not amazing.
500ml bottle - pours dark amber with white head. Aroma is malty, taste is malty,caramel. decent ESB
Pour is mostly clear ruby and brown, slightly off white head. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel, slight fruitiness. Taste is roasted malt, dark fruits, slight herbal spiciness, some bitterness.
A dark pour with a thick head. Strong, but smooth, malty flavor with a nice dry hop finish.
From bottle. Brown dark color with a tan head. Roasted malt aromas, hoppy finish. Alcohol dose seem to bite at first but doesnt last. Good drink over all
9/14/2011. From bottle. Brown color with a tan head. Roasted malt aromas, dried fruit, caramel, chocolate. Earthy, malty flavors, plenty of fruit and a light hoppy finish. Not bad at all.

Medium dark bourbon clear colour under a large size, fine bubbled mid-beige lasting head. Sweetish caramel malt n smokey oak aroma. Medium smooth body carrying a serious tangy, in your face bitter start. Lighter caramel sweet malt and nutty flavours with some recurring smokey woody character. Strongish bitter finish and aftertaste. Very pleasant drinking. Nice.
decent dark ale...malty, not quite robust. medium bodied with a sweet roasty finish. Id get again but wouldnt go out of my way...

Holy Grail bottle from Wilburs. Appearance: 2 fingers khaki head, dark brown color, clear, ok lacing. Aroma: roast, nutty, grass, light molasses, bread. Palate: full body, average frothy carbonation, oily texture. Taste: smooth sweet malt and roast, very light bitter on the end, super smooth. Overall, the mouth feel and taste of this beer are awesome, super drinkable, well done, and just impressive. Love the US artwork too.
Sweet malty aroma. Dark ruby colour with good head. Rich coffee and dark chocolate flavours with a smooth finish. Heavy body with low to medium carbonation.
Bottle shared with McTapps. Fine one with a thick background, some raisins, chocolate and leaves in the aroma. Tastes balanced with some ripe fruits, bit of malt. Good one.

Bottle from Morrisons in Newport. Pours out in a dark deep brown colour woth low smooth head and medium body. Aroma of roasted malt and barley. Taste of malt, roasted barley, straw, torf, woods and leaves. Malty finish with honts of nuts and light coffee. Nice one.
UPDATED: OCT 18, 2014 Belle couleur brun-rouge avec une petite mousse blanche; arômes de café et chocolat; goût bien équilibré entre douceur et amertume
Bottle from Asda. Pours a deep amber colour with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate. Taste also has caramel, with roasted malt, and chocolate.

Drunk from 50cl bottle bought in Wakefield. Strong ruby ale with creamy head.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bought it in the local tesco store it has been stored in the fridge. Pours ruby brown with a white rocky head. Coffee, roast aroma with mild bitter finish.

Nutty, strong caramel aroma bit of bitterness early. But thick and meaty as you'd expect of Yorkshire brews. Not much bitterness. Nice for winter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
500ml bottle from Cellarbrations Sandy Bay. Toffee red in colour with a tan head. Thin bodied but flavoursome.

Bottle. Pours dark red with a sizeable off white head which gradually disappears to a ring. Aroma of caramel, dark fruit, molasses, blackcurrant and roasted malt. Taste is roasted malt, caramel, blackcurrant and mild bitterness. Slightly warming, medium sweetness, medium body, kind of grainy, low carbonation.
Brown copper pour off white head. Nutty brown very English style. Dry nutty caramel malt grainy grist. Simple English beer with nice flavors.
Bottle at home; clear dark chestnut brown pour with bubbly off white head, rich fruit aroma, taste is sweet, with some bold fruit, caramel, nut, a porterish sweetness, coffee.

Aroma: caramel malts, pine, some hay. Appearance: very dark brown/black, medium frothy white head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: molasses, sweet dried fruit, light bitters coming up towards the average- to long-finish. Overall: very nice English Strong Ale, complex aroma and palate! Bottle from Beer Hawk, England.

Robust, rich and complex, but very well balanced. 
For me, espresso coffee and chocolate made the first impression, then not too far behind were malt, hops, liquorice and isoamyl acetate.
Perfect combination of sweetness and bitterness.
Drink enough of this and youll end up like the sheep on the label!
One of the nicest beers ive tasted. Can really taste the coffee and liquorice. Great dark roasty aroma too. I could drink this all night. (May blow my head off though lol.)
Valentines day present, A strong beer, pours a dark colour with a malty character

Lovely deep mahogany with a thinly clinging head and a treacly, faintly nutty and coffeeish nose. The palate has espresso bitterness yet without a strong coffee flavour, theres notes of cinder toffee, faintly of liquorice, and of dry, herbal hops.

500ml bottle. Clear, reddish chestnut colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, off-white head. Malty and fruity aroma, notes of red berries and their parings, a touch of cherry. Taste is dry malty, slightly fruity, cautious hints of cocoa powder. Nice, not more.
Bottle. Rich toffee malt with a bitter herbal hop finish. I thought this would be shite but its alright.
Decent enough bitter , not as creamy as many black sheep , better hop balance , a good glugging beer.

Overall it's not too shabby. Good malts and hoppiness, albeit a bit thin. Nice ESB-like slipperiness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fra flaske på Cardinaltreff des-13: storboblet skum. God esb-smak med ristet brød, fin bitterhet og lang ettersmak. Ikke spesielt fruktig, men lettdrikkelig uten at jeg velter over på ryggen.
500ml bottle from Asda, Dunbar. Pours dark brown, no head. Aromas are mostly metal and dark sugar. Taste is more of the same. Thin texture, sticky finish. Not very good.

Appearance: Clear dark ruby/brown with finger thick ivory head.
Aroma: Bread, pepper, raisin, floral, chocolate malt.
Taste: Medium bitterness, low/medium sweet and sourness.
Palate: Smooth thick texture, light/medium body, average carbonation, astringent, lingering chocolatey, marzipan dried fruity finish, with hints of pepper, sourness and burnt malt.
Comments: Very good and glass lace.

Bottle, 13. Clear reddish brown with an inch of light beige head that struggles to hang around. Aroma of toast and stewed fruit. Taste is sweet and fruity - prunes, banana - with a firm coffee-ish roasted note that militates against tcloy. Finish is bitter and a bit acrid. Pretty good, but the boldness of the roasted note verges on harsh.

Bottle from one of supermarkets. Poured a clear dark brown with a broken off white head. The aroma is dry malt with a little yeast. The flavour is medium bitter with a smooth hop liqourice bitter palate and a short bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Super a refreshing. A beer for all seasons.

Not bad. Kinda coppery to me with a weak nose. Good for some points in a beer club I guess. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bere foarte buna, strong taste, un pic am?ruie. Ceva nou, merit? încercat? din nou.. Cheers!

November 5, 2013 - bottle from Wine and Cheese. Bottled as Monty Pythons Holy Grail Black Knights Reserve. Clear light brown pour with some head. Aroma was roasted malt, toffee and fruit. Taste was roasted malt, some chocolate, toffee, fruit and mild hops. Medium bodied and relatively smooth. Fantastic movie and a solid brew. Any movie that has a quote of "I fart in your general direction" is a winner.

Bottle (black knights reserve dark Yorkshire ale). Pour is mostly clear ruby and brown, slightly off white head. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel, slight fruitiness. Taste is roasted malt, dark fruits, slight herbal spiciness, some bitterness.

50cl bottle. Pours dark amber with a moderate but mostly diminishing head, good lacing. Aroma is quite light. Some notes of roasted malt,breadish. Flavor is light to mderate roasted malt with a long bitterness. Better as it warms a bit.
Malziger, süßer Geruch. Starke, nachhängende Bittere. Starke Röstnoten. Interessante, gut ausgewogene Restsüße.

Bottle. Pours a deep amber color with a good frothy tan head that fades slowly to nice lacing. Aroma of roasted malt. Aroma of roasted malt, some chocolate, bit of coffee and malt sweetness. taste follows with roasted malt, dark chocolate, with some caramel sweetness, bit of coffee and nut. Nice bitterness and a dry finish. A very medium body, clean, smooth and creamy. Nicely balanced. Enjoyable beer to relax with.

16.9oz bottle 9/18/13 (Binnys Naperville)-48° in English Pint-Pours a darker brown with a big tan head. Aroma of malt, caramel, and toffee. Taste of the same with a charcoal taste in the middle. This medium bodied brew is not bad as I was expecting worse.
Dark copper with off-white foam head. Aroma is malty, bitter hops. Taste is bitter with chocolate tones. Nice lasting aftertaste. (Velp 201309)

Bottle. Pours rich coppery brown with thick beige diminishing head. Malty floral aroma taste is complex mix of hop bitterness combined with malty caramel has a nice dry edge with underlying moderate sweetness. Medium body.

Bottle, 21/08/13. Pours a dark auburn copper with a decent, beige head. Aroma is flowers, liquorice and roast. Taste is semisweet with liquorice, coffee and roast being in the forefront and having a strong presence. Some chocolate and caramel, but coffee and roast and liquorice overpower. Good carbonation, quite medium palate.
#100 bottle from supermarket. Dark amber, pours thin. Light soft head. Sufficient bubbles. Lovely taste.
500ml bottle - light tan headed dark ruddy ale, aroma of malty molasses, smooth bodied; nice taste of bitter, caramel, and a nuttiness - all rather fine.

7/13/2011: Monty Pythons Holy Grail Black Knight Reserve Dark Yorkshire Ale... Aroma: Caramelized malt. Appearance: Clean amber color with a lofty, foamy beige-colored head. Flavor: Malty, caramelized, roasty coffee undertones; mild, DRY herbal hoppiness in the finish. Palate: Medium-body; average mouthfeel. Overall: Actually, this is surprisingly flavorful, well balanced, and easy and enjoyable to drink; the commercial description is spot on: "A deep, ruby-chestnut brown ale topped by a near-white creamy head; rewards with a complex palate from roasted Marris Otter and Pale Chocolate Malts, and a dry Goldings hop finish. Cheers!"
1 pint 0.9 fl. oz. bottle (5.7% alc/vol) shared by Tmoney99. Thanks Tom! Rating #636 for this beer.

Bottle. 7/31/13. Pours a bubbly red with a fluffy but fleeting off-white head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, bread, licorice, bakers chocolate, dried fruits (banana, berries). Taste is surprisingly fruity, very dry; red berries, caramel, toffee, unsweetened cocoa, some grassy bitterness; finish is dry fruit, leather. Some light lacing. Medium-low carbonation. Mouth feel is oily, slick. Worth drinking.

500ml bottle, pours a ruby red with a small off-white head. Aroma is quite sweet caramel malt, with some chocolate & coffee in their too, berries and dark fruits come through with hints of ripe banana and a touch of alcohol. The palate is thick and creamy and the carbonation is low to medium. The finish is long and quite sweet, the bitterness is coming through but the sweetness lasts on the tongue. Good beer.

Bottle. Pours a dark nut brown with a half finger of khaki head. Aroma of roasty coffee malt, biscuits, caramel and dank herbal hops. Taste is light sweet. Caramel, brown sugar abd grassy hops. Light bodied with a thin yet slick texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, not bad. Nothing special but decent.
Bottle @ home. Clear brown pour, thin off-white head. Aroma of licorice, malty and English hops. Flavor is sweetish, quite bitter and malty. Typical English brew.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is deep roasty and liquorice malt, some english hops. Flavour is earthy hops, some liquorice and caramel malts. Nice.

500 ml bottle in New York. Pours a deep brown and a creamy, light tan head. Aroma has a strong toasted brown malt presence, very light banana notes with some very light grassy hops finish to the nose. Flavor starts off with a smooth toasted malt note with some light nuttiness, mild banana middle and finishes with a dry palate, bitter roasted presence.

From bottle a clear dark brown with a reddish tinge. A cereal chocolatey taste a thinly oily feel. Great beer that comes off darker than it is. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0,5L bottle. Strong yeast and bread aroma. Sour apple, bread, overcooked sugar and nice bitter on finish.

Very dark brown with a red tint. Lasting white head. Dark, rich malty and toffee aroma. The aroma is complex. The flavor has complex toffee malt character and chocolate. Its stronger, but still weak by American standards and I like that.
Really enjoyed the rich maltiness of this beer. Has well balanced bitterness and a full palate.
500ml bottle from Morrisons, Ayr - clear mahogany, thin beige head, malty, resinous aroma, toffee, resin, metallic, high carbonation, dry metallic aftertaste
500ml bottle courtesy of mr_h. Chestnut brown, decent beige foamy head. Sour vanilla malt aroma. Dry soapy resin malt flavour. Bitter aftertaste. Not my sort of beer.
More appropriate match ths week. Like the Norse link. Subtle malty undertones. Pleasure.

The aroma of this beer is fairly light with a fusion of caramel malts, banana, and sweet bread yeast, and the appearance is brown with a medium off-white head. The taste is mildly sour, slightly sweet, and a touch umami, and the palate combines an average carbonation, long astringent finish, medium body, slick texture. Overall, this beer isnt too amazing, but it is still an enjoyable and drinkable brew.

Just short of a stout in color and bitterness, could probably fool a novice. Deep dark brown with creamy beige head.  Aroma of coffee, chocolate, wood, smoke. Taste is chocolate , oak barrel, espresso. Finish is dry and abrupt with some lingering bitterness. If youre a fan of stout, give this one a try.

(Bottle): Pours a clear mahogany, small off white head with some moderate lacing. Lovely aroma of roasted malts and nuts with hints of some dark fruits. Taste is also of roasted malts but with bits of smokiness, coffee, nuts, dark fruit and a little bit of chocolate. Brilliant ale.

I found a bottle of "Monty Pythons Holy Grail Black Knights Reserve", and ratebeer redirected me to this page.

16.9 fl oz / 500mL bottle into a pint glass.

Aroma: Dark roasted malts, very slight yeast, and some slight hops. Smells kind of like a less hoppy Black IPA.

Appearance: Translucent dark ruby, with a creamy tan head that sticks around a little, but dissipates after a minute or so. Very thick lacing coats the glass.

Taste: Lots of caramel, lots of roasted malt that starts of bitter but goes sweet. Very, very mild hop bitterness contrast the malt. Subtle chocolate.

Palate: Full body, creamy and rich.

Overall: Not bad at all! Actually, its really quite good. The flavors in this beer compliment each other very, very well; they all work together, and play nicely on the palate. I wish I could find this stuff again.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2015 Served in a snifter, this Brown Ale pours a clear mahogany with a mostly short-lived tan head that manages to leave decent, spotty lacing. 

The rich aroma [8.5] is very appealing and promising, wit ample notes of dark fruits, toffee and roasted nuts. Hints of apples and woody hops. 

Taste: not what I expected from the nose.  The flavor is more malty with a darker roast and some burnt notes.  Bittersweet, with the bitterness dominating almost from the outset and leaving what I though was a slightly too bitter aftertaste. Those other aromas do appear, and include burnt toffee, toast, caramel, apples, a touch of smoke, dates and other vague dark fruits.  There are some earthy hop flavors in addition to the bitterness. 

M: medium-full body; very slightly astringent; medium carbonation.

O: Despite the comic marketing on the label, this is a serious beer worth seeking out if you like English style Brown Ales.

(lightly revised with bottle purchased and consumed in Fife, Scotland - May 2015)
Bottled 0.5l ; Devon ; UK ; Malty,roasted,fruit and cereal aroma ; Brown color with smaller head ; Medium sweet and bitter taste ; Nicely balanced ; Hoppy finish ; Great ESA.

Bottle. Dark brown beer with a small beige head that reduces with time. Aroma of roasted malts, port and chocolate. The taste is of dark fruits, port, chocolate and roasted malts with a touch of treacle. Medium bodied and chewy. A lot going on with this one. I have drunk this many times in the past but never really took time to realise the different layers involved in this. Excellent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Pours a dark amber. Smell of hops, yeast, and roasted malts. Tastes of roasted malts, with a bitter back end. Very short on the tongue with a medium body. Delicious Ale that goes well with cheese and bread.
Brown ale with next to no head, but very tasty.  Has plenty of burned coffee notes throughout.

Bouteille 500ml. De couleur brune-ambrée et claire. Nez de malt du genre caramel toffee terreux et légèrement rôti avec des notes de fumée de tabac, de fruits (fruits foncés), de noix et de houblon herbeux aux petites traces terreuses. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture légèrement crémeuse. Léger goût fruité (fruits foncés) accompagné de faibles traces de tabac lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de grains de malt légèrement rôtis et aux notes terreuses avec un léger goût de caramel toffee ainsi que de faibles notes de chocolat noir puis en finale lon retrouve une légère amertume de houblon herbeux aux notes florales et terreuses avec un léger goût de noix asséchantes. Post-goût moyen-long et plutôt sec, léger-moyen amer de houblon herbeux aux notes florales et terreuses avec un léger goût de rôti et de noix grillées ainsi que de faibles traces dalcool. (2006)
Pours a very dark amber.  Pleasant aroma of roasted malt.  Slightly less malt taste than the aroma would predict.  Very drinkable for a dark ale, slightly dry.

Clear dark chestnut with a small rocky head.  Aroma was malty and roasty with a little bubblegum and a little raisin.  Flavor was full bodied but odd flavored.  Nutty earthy malt tones mix with some dry dusty yeast tones, accompanied by that odd banana tone from the nose, as well as a bit of dark raisin, and roast.  Not terribly fond of this one.

500ml bottle. Appearance is a rich, dark brown with a small but nicely coloured (off white) head which lingered. Aroma is of malts, coffee and is bitter sweet. Taste is great. Nice full flavour with a decent amount of carbonation but not too much. A little coffee and smokiness with a good bitter taste of malts. I like black sheep and will be having this again.

Rich complex taste, sweet but a little sour as well, deep hop finish.  The whole thing very rounded and satisfying in the mouth. Aroma is strong, coffee, raisins. But whats it like?  It feels serious, wood-paneled rooms, quiet conversation, tobacco smoke hanging in the air.  A bit regency.

Bottle (500ml from Morrisons):
Once settled there is a mix of coffee and roasted malts coming through.There is some sugar and a definite fruity finish with some caramel in there too.

Chestnut brown colour with a really good, thick looking and foamy head about a thumbs width tall that manages to stay consistent without any noticeable reduction in size.

More pronounced than the aroma to begin with, there is some light caramel and a nice earthy malt taste to kick things off with. This is all followed by some bitter malts, a fruity sweetness and a nice biscuit flavour with a hint of vanilla at the end.

Medium bodied with moderate carbonation and a bittersweet mouthfeel and a slightly dry finish.

Starts off slow but gradually opens up and grows on you with the aroma becoming more noticeable and the taste was pretty good throughout. A very easy beer to drink and one that Id have again.

Bottle at the Dickens. Intense and balanced. Aromas of caramel, hints of chocolate and liquorice. Taste is sweet, with bitter notes, and long length. Palate is velvety, and medium bodied. Dark amber, with a frothy head.

500ml bottle. Dark ruby colour, with chocolate & coffee malt aroma and bubbly tan head. Initial fizzy sourish burnt dry coffee-malty (slighty dry hoppy) bitterness that then lingers, layered against a thick malty sweetness.

Deep dark brown amber with a red tint and a creamy lasting, tan head. Smells of deep malt, caramel (brown sugar) with a light roast and chocolate and coffee. Some berries, raisins, and other fruit elements like apple. Smells complex and rich. Medium to full oily body, soft carbonation. Sort of like a Bitter that molds into something more complex. Sweet toasted malt with toffee and caramel but then the fruit becomes more present with raisins, banana and then moves from sweet to a roast, chocolate, coffee and a hop liquorish dry finish that lingers. Easy to drink, delicious and is very moreish. Nice balance too. Mixing with rum?
My personal favorite bottled beer. A really good strong yorkshire ale. Prefer this to XB from Theakstons but its all about personal preference I spose.

#1396
Röstiges Kaffeearoma mit Zartbitternuancen dunkler Schokolade. Geschmacklich gehts in Richtung Stout: Röstmalzig, aber auch fruchtig nach Beeren (Brombeere trifft es am ehesten). Klingt sanft, nachbitternd und leicht rauchig aus. Das Schaf kommt bestimmt wieder auf die Beine, da bin ich mir ganz sicher. Lecker!

First impression is the smell of coffee and chocolate. Tastes of chocolate and other dark flavors. Pronounced roasty malt flavor and sweetness without being overbearing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasted from 1pt .9oz brown bottle into a tall tulip glass. It poured a clear but dark reddish-brown color with lasting beige foam and lace. Beautiful appearance. Aromas of sweet malt, citrusy hops, caramelized brown sugar, very strong fruity ale yeast esters, chocolate. Great malt complexity, bittersweet hops balance, flavors of raisins, wild cherries, black plums. Likely a long-boil, definitely tastes of kettle caramelization. Drier and less bready than I expected, tart almost to the point of sour, hint of lacto acid, well-rounded mouthfeel nonetheless with strong carbonation to splash it all around, persistent fruity aftertaste. Well-crafted, no flaws, a near-perfect "Big Brown Ale." Exactly my kind of beer.
Heavy on the chocolate, molasses and hops a most excellent beer and my personal favorite.

Pours ruby red with a thick creamy head. Nice, long lasting lacing.
Raisin fruit and banana aroma. Taste approaches a porter or even a stout, strong roasted barley. Chocolatey, chewy, long lasting finish.

Ill buy this bottle again (£1.59 from Morrisons).

Bottled. Dark red-brown colour, with a think, long lasting, light brown head of fine bubbles. Malt and hop aromas both strongly evident, with chocolatey flavours too. Generally smooth and well balanced, but the finish is slightly too dry and hoppy for my liking. Very good.

A - Clean rich brown with a beautiful had that lasted until the beer was finished. . . granted this did not take very long!

S- roasted malt, roasted nuts, a bit of spice, hint of sweetness

T- Again, roasty toasty nutty goodness! Still a hint of spices, and a bit of coffee and maybe a fruity sweetness as well.

M&D - Smooth, low creamy perfect carbonation. I could drink a couple of these and be very happy. Lots of flavor but it is gentle and treats your tongue like a lady.
Strong malty hop aroma.  Chocolate then toffee then molasses.  Hoppy top notes.  Toasted ending.

500ml bottle pours a light brown color with a finger of off-white head that leaves some spotted lacing on the glass.  Aroma is light roasted grains with an assertive floral and citrus hop note with some light fruits.  Taste is nicely balanced between the roasted malt and citrus bitterness and and a fruity and malty sweetness.  A very well done brew for the style and highly recommended.
This beer has a medium-to-full body, a depth of malty,treacly, toffeeish flavours and a mint-humbug hop finish.

Bottle.  Pours a deep copper brown color with a small beige head. The aroma was sweet malts, dark fruit and what I can only describe as candied malts.  The flavor was not nearly as sweet as the nose indicated; more herbal and grassy with moderately sweet malts and a light fruitiness.  Meh.
Typical weak platonic english dark ale. It has a sour finish, rootbeer in color, slightly-somewhat malty. Finishes very weak.

Bottle.  Pours copper with a large beige head.  Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, caramel and dark dried fruits.  Roasted malt and coffee flavor with hints of caramel sweetness, dark dried fruits and grassy/herbal hops.  Lightly bitter hop finish.
Poured from a 500ml bottle. There is a slight sour character, toffee, earthy, bready. A little thin.

Bottle at home. Dark cola brown, thin white head. Nice malty sweet nose, touch of treacle, touch of earthy English hops. Similar flavours, some cola sweetness, soft caramel, earthy peppery hops and a soft chocolate sweetness in the finish. Great.

dark brown, coke-like liquidm slightly see-through. pours a foamy head that disappears. the aromascape is dark and hidden, containing malt and dark sweet tones; hint of caramel and chocolate, bread, herb/seaweed qualities, dough and earth, moist leaves. The taste is rather awesome to be honest. The sweetness changes from honey-sweet to a wide, open and mild chocolate sweetness. this dances with the bitterness that is mild but nicely uplifts the malt. The sourness is gentle but not weak; its lifts up its head nicely when you seem to forget it was there. The palate makes this work even better by having a medium body with a surprisingly thick, oily texture. the carbonation is spot on, keeping things alive but not overwhelming anything. If the aroma was more open or intriguing, it would uplift everything a notch. A good beer, a good experience after tasting boring and bland beers one after another. Best beer so far from Black Sheep that Ive tasted.

Aug 2006 from BA: Dark Ruby Red, with a thick creamy coloured head which I poured into a Palm Tulip glass, this allowed the flavour and aroma to stay in the glass more than if I had just poured into a normal British pint sleeve glass. 

Burnt Malt and Hops come to the fore in the smell. 

The taste is strong on malt, but not overpowering, a slight fizz, but not gassy in any way. 

The throat holds the flavour (if you let it) and the mouth feel stays, this is not a watery beer. 

Very drinkable and must be tried with Wensleydale Cheese, they come from the same valley in Yorkshire.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a trappist glass.  Pours translucent medium brown with small beige head.  Little lacing, medium/light body, medium/low carbonation, and molasses aroma.  Taste is roasted malt, a little molasses, and a finishes wee bit dry light bitter.  More complex as it warms.
Bottle shared at home tasting.  Ruby brown pour with an off white head.  Aroma of sweet malts fruit and caramel.  Same aspects in flavour with a medium body and low to medium carbonation.

50cl bottle shared by Kermis.
Creamy white head.  Clear amber pour.  Nice beer.  Malty aftertaste

500 mL bottle from Beers of Europe into a pint glass.  Dark red/brown with a foamy head.  Roast, malt and hops blend, unusual but attractive.  A little roast, fruitiness, yet dry and surprisingly complex.  A particularly good beer from Black Sheep.

Great British Brew. Not too lasting, but there is rich dark malt. Im pretty sure theres mollasses in here, but I have no idea what they are or what they taste like, sounds right to me though for some reason.

Bottle at home in London. Pours clear garnet with a fluffy, off-white foam head. Toasted malt aroma with hints of chocolate and leaves. Flavor is quite nice, medium sweet, coffee ice cream, light mocha, leafy bitterness, faint toffee and toasted sugar. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Sweet finish with mild bitterness, more coffee ice cream character, faint ripe bananas, light dirt and fallen leaves. A very serviceable English strong ale. Not bad.
Dark brown, with hints of red, tan head that lingers and excellent lacing. Aroma of malt, and dark fruit. Taste is predominantly dark fruit with hints of chocolate. Good drinkability.

Strong malt and molasses aromas coming off a clear amber/orange body with a wispy off-white head created from very fine carbonation.  The molasses follows into the taste along with bitter and semi-sweet chocolate and a slight burnt/charred dryness and bitterness.  The body is quite thin making this easy to drink and food friendly.  Ends with a continuation of the the flavor with dark chocolate, molasses and tongue sticking dryness.   Definitely an English ale with a extra bitter side to it.
Bottle. Dark ruby-brown with an average sized light tan head. Aroma-taste: herbal, treacle, toffe apple, roasty, molasses, smokey finishing with a resiny bitterness. Medium bodied, low carbonation.

Pours a clear red-mahogany with a small tan head.  Aroma is banana, malt.....Taste is a smoky, roasted blend of floral hops, earth, and hints of licorice, coffee, tea and chocolate.  very dry.....an extremely tasty beer

500ml bottle in an English pint.  Pours ruby/amber with a lacy, cream-colored head.  Aroma of caramel malts, a little dark fruit, and some floral hops.  Flavor the same, a little sweet.  Average texture.  A decent beer.

A clear, deep red-mahogany pour with an off-white head.  It has a very malty aroma with caramel and a hint of dark chocolate.  The body is light with a watery texture and lively carbonation.  It has a bitter, roasted taste with a very dry finish.

Bottle pours a copper brown with a small white head. Smells tastes of caramel, bread, coffee, roasty, licorice, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, very nice smelly roasty semi bitter very nice glass was empty very fast.

Pours a clear garnet color with a full and lasting antique lace head with plenty of coating to the glass.  Robust earthy, caramely and almost smokey aroma.  Taste is sweet roasted malt, peat, caramel and licorice.  A quality English ale, to be sure.

Bottle 2 for afc championship game. Pours deep brown with small head and great aromas.  Tastes of dark fruit, vanilla, malt, black pepper, and light banana on finish.  Taste lingers a great January brew

Bottle: not quite clear brown with a tan head.  Musky aroma as well as vanilla, sweaty rope, ancient, and burnt sheep clippers. Fruity flavors of green grapes initially and then quickly turns to the papery, cardboard hops. Thin feel but actually quite an interesting brew. Tasty and refreshing.
UPDATED: FEB 13, 2012 16.9 oz bottle pours a deep brown with a white head. Aroma of toasted malt and a hint of chocolate.  Taste of Strong bread flavor, lots of rich English malt.

500ml bottle. Very dark red/copper in colour with a small, quickly dissapating head. Aroma is dominated by liquorice and dried fruits. Taste is light to medium sweetness, but a peppery dry bitterness dominates and remains in the finish. Mouthfeel is smooth, with very little carbonation.

Out of the bottle in a pint glass. Nose is espresso, sweet malts, sea water, and chocolate. Palate is light yet soft with a slight effervescence. Taste starts out like a traditional english ale, and then blooms to complexity. Banana in the middle of the bell in the back of the palate, liquorice, chocolate, seaweed. Finishes with a note slight note of espresso bitteness that lingers. Tasty, complex, intriguing, drinkable, unique, a very nice beer worth picking up or adding rum or a nice peated scotch/ sweet bourbon to.

Heady liquorice, toffee and mild banana notes. Quite hoppy and dry. Not too harsh. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Marketed as the Holy Grail Ale Black Knights Reserve. Pours a deep brown with some ruby notes in the coloring and a creamy, light tan head. Aroma has a strong toasted brown malt presence, very light banana notes with some very light grassy hops finish to the nose. Flavor starts off with a smooth toasted malt note with some light nuttiness, mild banana middle and finishes with dry, bitter roasted presence. The beer has a nice creamy feeling with a pretty good amount of mouth feel. Overall an okay brew but nothing special to write home to my wife about.

10/24/11. 16.9oz bottle labeled as Monty Pythons Holy Grail Black Knights Reserve. Brown/red pour with a nice thick, creamy tan head that sticks and laces a teensy bit. Weird aroma od chalk, burnt bread, metal, and caramel apples. Sweet caramel entry with a burnt toast flavor followed by lingering chalk and a huge metal kick. Blech.

500. Thanks to one of the finest people you can imagine, hand-delivering this bottled delight without warning out of the goodness of his heart. Fetchez la vache! Pours an opaque ebony, nearly black, with a dense and creamy tan head that falls quickly to a sturdy disc. Not a bad looking beer at all. Naughty, naughty Zoot. Big tart treacly molasses and plums nose, kind of sweet and Christmassy, which wasnt what I was expecting from a bitter, but its not at all unpleasant. Creamy medium body with soft carb. Dark pitted tree fruit and some gingerbread on the mid palate. Big acetic crackery hop finish, kind of airy and peppery. Nothing about this beer did what I expected it to do, which is kind of cool. Why do you think I have this out-a-rageous ac-sawnt?

Bottle from Tesco
Appearance - Dark amber, thick off white head with good lacing.
Aroma - Caramel and roasted malts, fruity, not much hop.
Taste - Light roast malt, caramel malt, sweet malts, bit of spicy hop, hint of pepper, liquorice, bit of earthy yeast. Well balanced rich and fairly complex.
Palate -  Bitter rather earthy finish with roasted malt. Low carb, quite smooth, bittersweet initially but finish is more bitter but not astringent.
Overall -  Good quality, rich ale, well balanced and good tasting.
Dark ruby brown color with fine tan head. Sweet aroma. Flavor is sligthly roasted and bitter.

Dark amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted sweet malt, caramel, & some fruit; Flavor of slight roasted sweet malt, caramel/toffee, hops, fruit, and some nuts; Finish is slightly bitter; Overall, very tasty and quite good.
UPDATED: AUG 14, 2011 Bottle 0,5ltr: Clear brown/ruby coloured ale with an fine roasted malts taste and hints of banana or maybe apple. And a good foamy head too, for English beer though.

Bottle shared by beerandblues2 at the 5/7/11 DC Ratebeer gathering. Pours a clear copper color with a large frothy tan head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of toffee, fruity notes and leafy hops. The taste is toasted malts, bitter hops and stone fruits. Medium bodied.

Aroma was pure malt with some nice fruitiness in there as well. Caramel abound with a pungent fruitiness. Tasted really smooth compared to what I expected. Bitter but incredibly drinkable. I really liked the smooth nature this one had. Other than that, smooth caramel malts were mainly in the taste. Nice one.
Really good aroma, strong, with plums, caramel, bananas and fresh bread. Fairly well carbonated, malty with some earthy hops. Enjoyable beer,

Pours a nice deep orange. The head is creamy and thin, with milky lacing. With a medium body, it is lightly carbonated. The aroma is rich and sweet, consisting of caramel, bananas and hops with a hint of cinnamon. Though the initial taste is bitter, it is smooth with hops and sweet malts. Just a tinge of bananas and spicy sweet malts are before a dry and bitter aftertaste. This is one of a few old ales Ive had, and a very delicious and drinkable one at that.

bottle, ASDA, full malty aroma, brown to dark colour, clear, brown foam, rocky head, very bitter, medium sweetness, full body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, bitter, Very nice beer full tasty, mega bitter.
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: Moderately sweet, malty, lightly hoppy amber ale. A bit thin, but solid with a slightly bitter finish.

Bottle.  Pours clear amber with a medium, creamy beige head, medium-short retention with fair lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread, toast, caramel), light hops (earthy), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of dates and brown sugar.  Flavor is heavy malt (bread, toast, caramel), light hops (earthy), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of dates and brown sugar.  Medium body, warmth, and carbonation with a sweet finish.
Bottle @ Costa Real w Ramenen. Malty and herbal, slight hops. Food Pairing: Lamb chops.

Malty toffee nose. Crystal clear tea color, medium yellow head, good lace. Flavor is tame with little character. Malty berries, with hints of toffee. Too dry and too little flavor. I would not seek this out again.

Translucent like clear, dark tea.  Some head reamains next to the runny lacing both off white.
Very little aroma of  dough and cooked vegetables.
Taste is a little salty.
Palate is thin with an abrupt finish but lively carbonation.

500ml bottle from LCBO. Poured amber with an off-white foamy head with good retention and some good lacing. Aroma is dry caramel malt. Taste is a mix between dry malt with subtle notes of caramel and an English hop ending. Average body with some medium carbonation. Well done.
UPDATED: AUG 25, 2013 Aroma is dark malts, mild scotch notes and fruit.  The flavor is fruit/berries, mild/medium sweetness, malts and a slightly tangy/tart finish.

(bottled) Deep ruby ,creamy subsiding head,  roasty ,toasty malt nose , with dark fruits (pulm ,raisins) and dark sugars, earthy rich maltiness. Roasty notes in the mouth.  jamish , earthy caramel ,raisins , spicy hop bitterness cuts the roasty malt textures.  Good room temp kinnda ale , even if i drank it chilled.

a very enjoyable ale..a little light for an old ale, both in body and in abv, but very drinkable, one of the first i tried to test myself on and determine the style by the aroma and flavor, old ale was my second guess. not going to say what my first guess was. very good.

500 ml bottle from The Royale.  Pours a deep amber color with a finger-thick beige head that pours and settles unevenly.  Aroma of toast, earth, caramel malts, overripe fruit, banana bread, and grass.  Flavor is the same, with a dank, earthy, bitter quality.  Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a toasty, earthy mouthfeel.  These Black Sheep beers arent doing much for me.

Lucent brown, thin beige head, medium-light body, medium-high carbonation.

Aroma: sweet toffee malt, fruity esters, some minerality, ant a faint hint of leafy hops.

Taste: brown malt, toasted bread, leafy hops (not notably bitter or aromatic -which means nicely balanced i guess), and a subtle hint of peat smoke.

Rich and complex, but balanced. More brown ale than old ale, as there are no descernable alcohol or oxidative notes. Would be much better on cask. It has a very nice smoke character which adds depth and complexity to the roasted malt character.

From a 12 oz bottle, poured a copper color with a foamy tan head and good lacing. Nose of toasted malts and ripe fruit. Medium body and smooth mouthfeel.  Flavor of the roasted malts with coffee.  Light bitter finish. Quite decent.
A strong ale, nicely mixing malt and grain with hoppiness.  Full of flavor, but a little heavy.  After two pints over an hour and a half, I felt more bloated than I would like.

Pours ruby/copper with a quickly fading head.
Nose shows rich malt with sultanas, dried figs and caramel. After swirling, some banana can be detected.
Flavours are similarly rich and sweet with more dried fruit, caramel and bready malt. Finishes weakly on an oxidative note.
Carbonation is too high for these flavours and cuts out the finish unnecessarily.
Bottle from Morrisons. Dark brown colour and tan head. Nose of roasted malts, bit of fruits. Flavour of roasted malts, dark fruits, bit of chocolate. Medium bodied. Easy drinkable.

Cool looking half liter bottle pours clear deep amber with tan head. The aroma is a pleasing mix of earthiness, fig, black licorice, chocolate and boysenberry. The taste is pretty full with licorice, earthiness, spicy hops and then becoming sweeter and sweeter with the addition of dates, boysenberry, grapes and red apple skins. Rich sweet earthy brew.

Pours clear brown with a nice bit khaki head.  Aroma full of toasted nuts, brown bread, light-roast coffee.  Flavor actually starts with a dollop of crisp hops, before settling into a nice blend of keep toffee, toasted malt, coffee, and hints of acidity.  Balance is a strength here.  The hop presence upfront surprised me, but added to the experience.

Sherry and molasses in the aroma.  Nice two-finger, tan head.  Deep reddish-brown color.  Tastes of molasses with carmel and a hint of licorice.  Very rich body and a notably bitter finish.  Enjoyable complexity, very nice.
500ml bottle.  Pours very dark amber with a large head.  Aroma is bread, slightly sour dried fruits.  Sour, dry finish.  Great in the mouth, but just nothing to write about on the taste.
UPDATED: FEB 2, 2015 I would have thought more a brown ale.  I quite liked this. Nice levels of roast and malt, but rather drinkable. Serving: Bottle
Bottled. Poured darkish, some malts and hops, pretty well done for the style.........

Enjoyed from a 16.9oz bottle in a flared wine glass.  The beer pours a very deep brown to black color, with a moderate light tan head.  The nose shows notes of toffee, pale chocolate malt perhaps, and a bit of what seems to be peat.  The palate is a pleasing combination of medium crystal and low roasted malt sweetness.  A small amount of yeast character also comes through.  The palate is carbonated beautifully, and shows a melange of flavors that range from caramel to toffee to quasi-chocolate.  Hops are not prevalent, other than to balance, perhaps.  The finish leaves a pleasing malt note on the palate.  Overall, a very good example of the style.
bottle @ Allen St Hardware, Buffalo. Dark brown pour, roasted malts, coffee notes in the aroma. Nice roasted malt flavor, coffee, medium mouthfeel. Decent
Deep brown colour. Thick foamy head. Slight touch of aniseed in the aroma. Bittersweet flavour with some tobacco and treacle present.

Black Sheep Brewery Plc.--Riggwelter Yorkshire Ale--2004 16.9 oz. Bottle.  5.70% ABV.  20 IBUs?  (4.0 / 5.0)  Amber Ale.  Light sediment.  Bottle Conditioned.  Fizzy mild lace head.  Clear dark amber bronze color.  Toffee fruit mild English hop no stank front.  Dry sweet black cherry toffee sweetbread body.  Clean crisp refreshing mild hop citrus fruit hint end.  Aged well.  Sampled 4/12/2008.

Just a hint of fruit in the nose, its mostly the malt but the roastedness comes out nicely. Nice head on pour, dark brown/golden, clear if when you can see through it, not a lot of lacing. Sweet, the roasted flavours come out here very nicely too. It goes down smooth and frothy and you get a lasting taste of hops and the roasted barly on your tounge. It lasts quite a while and is quite tasty. This would be a nice beer to have a cigar with.

Pours a real dark brown with an off white head.The aroma is of coffee,roasted malts, and strong fruit notes.The flavor is a nice mild coffee with bitter hops.The finish is dry and the aftertaste is a little bitter.Overall a good brew from the UK.

500ml bottle. Pours an almost opaque dark brown, with an attractively foaming head. There is a predominant aroma of freshly brewed black coffee, with some very slight fruity hints. The coffee continues into the initial taste, mixed with some herb hops. This continues into a lingering dry finish, dominated by the flavour of very high-cocoa dark chocolate. A delicious, strong dark beer.

Very dark brown pour.  Bottle from world of beer in S Fla.  Aroma of dark malts, overripe fruit, some toffee.  Flavor is pretty boring and actually not so good.  A bit of overripe fruit, spent malt, spent hops...meh.

This strong Yorkshire ale pours a clear deep copper colour with a beige head that has decent retention and lacing. The nose is banana bread mixed in with roasted malt and mild caramel. The mouthfeel is pretty watery with a little stickiness. Nice roasted malt flavour with a dry and bitter (but not too much) finish. A good darker strong ale, from a brewery I always enjoy.
Pours dark brown in the glass. Nose and taste is pleasant malts with hint of bakers chocolate. Rated 7/2/02

I was fairly impressed by this one.  Shared one with my father-in-law between whiskies.  Poured a clear brown with a quickly diminishing head.  Roasty malt and caramel aroma.  Nice caramel taste with a little bit of bitter to it.  A damn good beer.

Tasty Beer!  Pours quite a deep reddish-brown with a good size foamy head.   Lots of roasted malts in this one, from start to finish providing sweetness and bitterness.  Light bit of hopping on the end.  The alcohol taste bites more than youd expect for a 5.7%.  Its got lots going on, and it does it all well.
Could almost pass for a porter.

clear and medium brown with thick white head.  floral hop nose with some crystal malt.  firm bitterness, especially for the style.  raison like crystal malt character and nice chocolate notes without bitterness.  some yeasty esters and some floral hops in there.  a lot of flavor in this brew.  very good
Bottle. Pours dark copper with a creamy beige head and a grain and toffee aroma. There is a rich roasted malt flavor with lots of toffee and a slightly bitter finish. A pretty good brew.
Dark in color with a creamy head, slightly red hue. Aroma and flavours of roasted malts, burnt sugar. Slightly fruity. After an initial hint of sweetness, quite a dry hoppy finish.

Bottle. Pours a deep mahongany with large creamy coloured head. Nice lacing. Aromas of tooffee, toasted malt, dark choclate and some resiny hops. Perhaps a little dark fruit as well. Nice and not what I expected. Taste is quite bitter thanks to both the hops and the toasted malt. Also some alcohol and a little sweetness. Mouthfeel is medium with some alcohol showing through. Really enjoyed this one and definately not what I expected.

50cl bottle.   Medium clear brown with a lasting light beige head.   Lots of toffee, toasty malt, light chocolate, and fruity yeast in the aroma.   Almost like pastry dough with a nice yeast character.   The flavor is medium-sweet with medium, balancing bitterness and light toasty and roasty malt flavors.   Bitterness lingers in finish a touch.   Medium body with medium carbonation.  The flavor has a touch too much bitter and astringency for the overall balance, but a pretty nice beer overall.

Bottle - Dark reddish/brown.  Good beige head. Slightly frothy mouth feel at first. Sweet, caramel and roast malts. Fruity and Spicy. Touch of warming alcohol.  Mild to medium bitterness.  A very nice drop.

Bottle.

A - Dark mahogany brown and ruby with a moderate sized beige head that sticks around for a while.

S - Toasted malt and some dark earthiness. Some chocolaty and coffee in there too.

T - Toasted malt and chocolate and coffee are the most present. Hints of tobacco. Kind of like an earthy flavored stout. Very slight hop bitterness. The sweetness edges out this though.

M - Fairly chewy and smooth but probably medium body at most.

D - I really liked drinking this and would probably be able to drink a few.

Note: Seemed kind of like a lighter and earthy stout, and was quite enjoyable.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2013 Love this beer. Nutty aroma. Clear chestnut brown. Rapidly disappearing head. Nice and bitter. 8 4 8 4 17 ### Rerate: Toffee, spice, fruit. Very malty. Deep brown with a tan head that has excellent retention. Bitter. Dry finish. 8 5 8 4 16 ### Dark cherry to mahogany body. Large off white head with good retention. Nose is hops, malt, alcohol, dark fruit (especially dark cherry), toffee, a hint of chocolate, black malt, spice, crystal malt. Bitter. Dry finish. 7 5 7 4 14 #### Bottle. Thin tan head with poor retention. Clear deep purple body. Almost like a porter. Roasty. Marris Otter malt. Dememera sugar, raisins, port, ginger(?). Nutty. Fruity and multi-faceted, with a red wine taste. Bitter with sweet notes. Dry finish. 7 5 7 4 15

Provdatum: 2005-10-15 
En rikt guld upplevelse - den var fin!

AP: Creamy head, brownish colored body
AR. sweet malt & dried raisins. 
F: great bitterness, malt and some sweetness

AROMA: hay, resin, dough,
APPEARANCE:  golden, brown, 
TASTE: medium bitterness
PALATE: medium body, oily feel, medium body, lively, long bitter aftertaste
Dark burgundy pour. Nose has some chocolate (milkshake), honey, some bread.  A toasted nutty flavor with some hop dryness to it.

~Aroma of bread, caramel, pepper, nutty,chocolate, molasses, and treacle
~Pours a deep clear ruby garnet color with small creamy off white head.
~ Nutty, bready, roasty, caramel flavor, with treacle and a mild bitterness.
~Med body med CO2, lingering roasted bitter finish.
~Enjoyable brew. Complex maltiness, nice aroma and flavor.

0,5L bottle.
Deep amber body, smal off-white foam.
Toffee-like aroma, roasted undertones of smoke and charred wood, spicy hops in the mix.
Full body, slight drying texture and astringency, medium-high carbonation.
Burnt toffee, mild roast coffee, hints of plum and leafy spice.
Bitter finish, slight booziness. Solid roasty ale.

Bottle. Pours with a clear burnt orange to brown colored body and a decently sized off-white head. Aroma of earth, wet leaves, toffee, chocolate, leather and a hint of freshly cut fruit (stone fruit or pears, not sure, very faint).  Taste is light roast, toffee, leaves, decently harsh bitterness, smoke, and the brulee part of a creme brulee.  Medium bubbles. Easy to drink. Lots of nuances.

(Sample Date: 7/24/2009   Source:Other)   500 ml bottle. Aroma of caramel with some roast and toasty malts. Clear amber brown with large fluffy head. Lightly sweet flavor of caramel with just a hint of roastiness and earthy hops. Dry finish that is lightly bitter.

500ml bottle from the local store near my dads place in Norwich, drunk 26th Dec 09. Deep reddish brown with a diminishing magnolia head. Full bodied with a caramel malt flavour. Some fruitiness and herbs too. Long bitter finish. Coats the mouth well. Better than many bottled beers of this sort.

Bottle. Pours clear dark amber with a bubbly beige head that quickly settles to surface cover. Aroma has notes of sweet malt, dark fruit, brown sugar and cherries. Flavour is quite malty and not as sweet, has notes of dark chocolate, cherries, cloves, anise and malt. Smooth, almost oily, mouthfeel with minimal carbonation and a fairly bitter finish. Overall a very nice, slightly unusual old ale.

THOUGHTS: It might have been a little skunked or at least a little past its prime. Not as flavorful as most old ales. A little thin too. Probably not skunked. Not the best old ale, but a nice beer.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a clear, light to medium brown with dark amber highlights and an average to large, creamy, tan head that mostly diminished and left good lacing. The aroma was moderate to heavy dark bread and caramel malt; slight milk chocolate; light herbal hops; light to moderate earthy yeast; banana, a little sour fruit; and sugar water. The initial flavor was rather sweet, slightly sour and a little bitter; while the finish was sour and a little bitter with an average to long duration. There was caramel malt, a little maple syrup, fruit, yeast, metallic hops, sugar water, and a little herbal hops. It would have been cloying if not for the dry bitter finish. Nice balance. The nearly medium body was fairly oily and then dry with soft yet tingly carbonation and a moderate to heavily astringent and slightly chalky finish.

Creamy, tan head that is a little oily.  The retention was surprisingly short.  Beautiful mahogany color.

Aromas is a sweet malt.  On the initial taste, the malts were not as pronouced as expected, however the mid-palate carried strong, dark malts and dried raisins.  A lot going on in this beer through the mid-palate.

Bitterness really comes through on the finish, although the finish left quickly, leaving sweet tar flavor on the lips, and a tingly, viscous feeling.

Because of its style and origin, i would serve this with a hearty beef stew.

bottle from work. dark red brown colour, beige head, little lace. meaty, roast coffe aroma with a big chunk of chocolate. sweet malty flavour, with even more chocolate, well balanced and good alcohol, lovely fine bitter finish. gorgeous beer.
Pours brown with a big beige head. Aroma of roast and caramel malt. Flavor is roast malt, chocolate, with a long bitter finish.

Serving: 500 ml. bottle.
Appearance: Brown with garnet highlights.  Foamy, light tan head.  Decent lacing left behind.
Aroma: Vinous notes, raisin, caramel, and a slight metallic note.  Not terrible, but not stellar either.
Flavor: A little fruitiness, caramel malt, slight roasted notes, herbal hops, and perhaps a slight burnt note.  Something I cant quite place.  
Palate: Smooth, medium-low carbonation with a medium mouthfeel.  Long, bitter and roasty finish.  This one had odd aftertaste that seemed to stick to my mouth.  Not exactly pleasant.
Overall:  Decent flavor at first, but the lingering bitter aftertaste that wouldnt go away really dragged this one down.  Okay, but certainly not worth seeking out, especially since you pay a premium for this one to be shipped across the pond.
Bottle from Morrisons supermarket Hatch End. Ruby coloured pour with a decent fluffy head. Dark fruit aroma. Dark fruit, chocolate, roasty taste. Solid easy drinking old ale.

Ruby Coloured, big off-white head.
Nose: Malt, slight herb. 
Taste: Treacle, bitter chocolate, roast nuts, quite bitter. 
Ok but nothing special.

Bottle shared with funkybrewster.  Pours a glowing dark very rich red, but absolutely clear, with a tall thin airy foamy light beige froth.  Aroma is a mix of sweet and fruity and dark and roasty, some light butter, rich roasted coffee and chocolate.  Flavor leads with a nice alcohol and bitter combination smoothing into a glassy sweetness with subtle fruit and some light butter, finishes with an odd combo of bitter coffee, roasted malt and sweet fruits.  Rich and very bitter.  Seems like the bitterness is mostly attributed to the hard roasted malt even though there is a definite hop bite left in the the aftertaste.  Medium bodied, very smooth, glassy, softer sizzling carbonation adding some fluffiness.

Thanks 17th floor! Pours a lovely reddish brown with a nice thick billowy off white head. Aroma is, as 17thfloor said, quite portery. Really strong dark roasted malts, nice character of raisins hiding behind a slight coffee and toast note. Flavor starts with a bit dark roasted malt, again some coffee beans and dark fruits provide a soft sweetness. Finishes with a much more aggressive bitterness and peppery quality that completely opposes the soft sweet middle. Medium body and a soft carbonation. Interesting old ale, very much based around those roasted malts rather than the dark fruits.
Such a lovely fluid this pours, a rich reddish brown and an aroma to match.  Adequate head but the best is in the complex taste, with hints of malt and chocolate.  Gotta like it.

I had this in the bottle at the French Laundry in Fenton, MI. It poured a darker amber, and had a very pear like aroma. The flavor was also of pears, and was really light. Good session beer,  but I dont think I would get it again. Cheers!
I had this at a session ale tasting. Toasty, roasty and pretty nice to drink, I liked it.

Bottle courtesy of MaltDawg from Wine Warehouse on 07/24/2009. Very clear dark amber bod ywith a large frothy off-white head. Sweet caramel, toasty malt, and light fruity aroma. Sweet toasty malt flavor, some caramel and earthy hop notes and some light fruitiness. Medium light body with moderate carbonation.
Large bottle. Not a bad brew but was put off a bit by the pronounced alcohol taste despite only being a 5.7 abv.

Bottle: Ruby pour with a nice lacing consistent tan head. Tons of berries in the aroma- some toasted malt notes in the background (crystal malt) and some British ale yeast estery fruitiness. Light fluffy feel. The flavor is both earthy and fruity. Has a berryish note at the fore, then comes more malt character with dark mildly roasted flavors and a slight fruit skin bitterness. Some very mild underlying dark cocoa and a toasted raisin note. The finish as a moderate peppery bitterness to balance. A decent and sessionable Old Ale.
Pours brown with a nice tan head.  Aroma is faint caramel with a hint of fruit.  Flavor is roasted malts, caramel and brown sugar, with a slight nutiness.  Pretty good.

Excellent first impressions on taste and aroma. Poured out a very nice looking crystal clear deep mahogany beer with a small white cap that leaves a bit of ropy lacing. There is still lots to love for aroma here but after letting it breathe for 10 minutes much of the early charm has hidden itself. Well defined roasted malts and nuts are the most forward but now its quickly joined by something that is reminiscent of sweat and corn. OK, Ive left it for 10 minutes more and things are slowly returning to Happyland. Background coffee, some fruit that seems to be raspberry in nature. I actually think the aromas I though sucked are actually tobacco related and now I accept it. The taste is still pretty fine though: good roast balanced nicely with perfectly strengthed bitterness, slight slight coffee, corn husks, interesting spice that comes out later, mild caramel. Well carbonated, good bitter finish with lingering dull malts. A lot of these would be nice. I did get bored after awhile though...
Thin off white head over a dark caramel bronze body.  Aroma is fruits, caramel sweet malts.  Taste is big fruits, syrupy, chocolate, but a harsh thinning almost alcohol like finish.

Bottle. Nice dark brown with a red hue, pours a thick off-white head with decent lacing.  Immediate caramel, banana, and dark fruits on the nose. A buttery soft biscuit character lurks underneath, along with a slight ashy character, and some nice roastiness.Palate is darker and softer than expected. Roasty, rich, buttery, not as sweet as I had anticipated, nice hoppiness comes through in time, more towards the rather soapy finish. Good, but the palate isnt as complex as Id hoped.
bottle, dark ruby brown color with thick foam, aroma is malty nutty, caramel, flavor is good mix of ripe plum, nuts , some hoppiness, sour bitter finish

Very dark brown crystal clear with some red elements. Cap is thick and nipple shaped , has very good retention. Lots of banana, caramel, milk chocolate, and mild hops show up in the aroma. After a minute all aroma seems to vanish. First sip seemed watery but then coffee and malty wood, with the some bitter hops starts showing up. Taste is so clean not a single trace of the beer lingers. Hops are very noticeable but I cant seem to nail down what they taste like. Ok beer to have but Ill most likely never purchase again

(bottle - 500 ml) Dark copper pour with a thick off-white head. Aroma is malty and earthy with some hints of hops and some toffee. Flavor begins sweet and malty with a light sour note near the end. A large roasted malt blast comes through right at the end. Smooth and bitter at the finish.

Another bottle of beer my Dad left at my house after his most recent visit.  And this one is....nice.  5.7% ABV is not an ABV appropriate for an old ale; to my mind this beer is more like a nice Bitter or maybe a really mild Scottish Ale.  Malty, coppery, with a touch of hop.

Color is dark, and head was plentiful at first but faded quickly.  Aroma was coppery maltiness, toffee-ish malt, and some light coffee roastiness.  Flavor is more of the same, and is pretty good.  This beer is a really nice balance of taste and drinkability, but the flavor, while pleasant, is mild and that mildness is a strike against it from my perspective.  Mouthfeel is substantial.

I liked this beer.  It isnt the RIS, DIPA, Tripel, Berlinerweisse, Flemish Sour or other big-flavor-packing style I usually favor, but it is still good.

For the first time since my Dads last visit, Im saying I am glad he left this beer at my house!  Recommended.

Good beer. Got this bottle last week at Sams in Chicago. Poured with a medium sized tan head and a little lace. Lots of aroma: malty, roasty, caramel, toffee, dark and medium fruit, chocolate and other stuff - seems like I could almost go on forever if I wanted to. Color is an almost hazy dark amber. Flavor is similar to aroma. Is some creaminess there from mild carbonation. Leaves a mild brandyish finish. Could be a session beer if I were going slow as it is a bit rich.

A beer of cherry wood color with a decent tan head that leaves a sticky lacing.  Aroma is caramel and floral hop.  Flavor is interesting and bounces around enjoyably.  It is caramel, rye, roasted malt, floral and citrus hop, chocolate, and spice.  It tries to be creamy but is a bit too thin.  I do like the fun complexity and the fact that this beer is all over the place in taste.

Dry and roasted, to be sure.  If guinness were an ale, this is what I would expect.  Chalky, dry roast coffee aromas.  Some dry chocolate and a slightly bitter, very roasted palate.  The question here is on the tongue, where the beer is slightly thin and lacks assertiveness.  Its clearly not a smoked ale, but there is little to advance the palate beyond the roasty, yet watery, texture.

Aroma is some malt and a little skunk. Pours a dark reddish-brown with a pillowy off-white head.  Flavor is a little roasted malt, something twangy and a strong hoppy finish.  Not very pleasant.  From the other reviews, Im wondering if my bottle is a little off. DNF.
Sturdy and powerful drop.  Deed deep black with a tar taste.  A little too sweet.  Would prefer a Tooheys Black.
Bottle a WOB.  Pours a dark brown/amber.  Thin tan head.  Malty fruit aroma with a roasted pineapple banana flavor.  Dry hoppy finish.  Decent brew.

Bottled(500ml). -Nice dark red ruby coloured, medium sized lasting beige head, malty chocolate nose. Light roasted malt, chocolate and toffee taste with notes of coffee and caramel. Bitter and mild spicy finish.

500ml brown bottle. Deep red-brown coloured beer with a small creamy layer of foam on top. Aroma is roasty, chcoolate malts/cocoa. Flavour has chocolate malt and hint of fruit at the start. Late citrus bitterness lingers for a while. Roasty and dry end. Medium body and fairly strong carbonation. A nice pint.

FRom the bottle. Looks great deep mahogony color. Aroma of chocolate and roasted malts. Flavor is very dry, chocolate on the palate and very toasty. I amvery impressed The golding hops are very noticable. This is a great beer.
bottled. Poured clear reddish brown with lasting off-white head. Sweet malty raisin aroma. Light mouthfeel. Roasted malts with some caramel. Slight metallic dry finish.
Bottle, pours a nice dark red color with a light head. Nice darker flavor notes a bit of tannic properties add a nice dryness to the brew. Light hops a bit fruity but very pleasant and easy to drink.

Appearance: ruby red/brown with a small white head. Aroma: malt, chicory, cream.  Flavour: lots of malt, quite dry, chocolate, coffee and some pepper. The finish is long and malty with a coffee aftertaste. Great beer.

Pours with four finger cream head that fades slowly leaves a good lace. Clear deep amber color. Light earthy nose. Medium carbonation and medium bodied. Flavor is nearly balanced but hops win, some initial sweetness. Hop bite at finish that lingers. 500ml bottle from Barbs Beer Emporium Concord, NH.
Dark brown colour with roasted malt, chocolate and vanilla smell.  Taste is mild coffee with malt and citrus.  Very nice beer.

pours a dark brown with a small biege head, and limited lacing.

smell is of wheat, some fruits and berries, and some roasted malts.

taste is of cocoa, wheat, a touch of coffee, malt, and dark fruits.

Pours a mahogony colour with a nice sized head. Aroma has a lot of dehydrated banana. Some coffee in there as well with dark chocolate, and vanilla.
